description.short: Measures vulnerability to decision-making errors triggered by artificial scarcity, limited-time offers, and resource pressure that bypass rational security judgment
description.context: When humans perceive scarcityâ€”whether of time, resources, or opportunitiesâ€”cognitive capacity diminishes by the equivalent of 13 IQ points (Mani et al., 2013). This tunneling effect causes individuals to focus narrowly on the scarce resource while neglecting security considerations, creating exploitable pre-cognitive vulnerabilities through limited-time phishing, fake opportunity scams, and deadline-driven bypass requests.
description.impact: Organizations with high scarcity susceptibility experience successful deadline-pressure social engineering, limited-offer fraud, and resource-competition attacks. Employees under perceived scarcity make impulsive decisions, skip verification procedures, and comply with urgent requests without security assessment. Loss aversion amplifies impact by 2.5xâ€”people work harder to avoid losses than acquire equivalent gains.
description.psychological_basis: Cialdini's Scarcity Principle (2007): Items become more attractive when availability decreases. Shah & Shafir (2012): Scarcity creates attentional tunneling and reduces executive function. Mani et al. (2013): Financial scarcity reduces cognitive capacity by 13-14 IQ points. Kahneman & Tversky (1979): Loss aversion causes losses to be weighted 2.5x more than equivalent gains. Neurologically, scarcity activates anterior cingulate cortex (error detection/urgency), reduces prefrontal cortex activity (rational planning), and triggers amygdala activation (fight-or-flight responses).

sections.title: QUICK ASSESSMENT

items.title: Mandatory Cooling-Off Periods
items.question: When employees receive urgent requests requiring security bypasses or high-risk actions, are mandatory waiting periods enforced before approval?

options.label: Mandatory cooling-off periods (minimum 2-24 hours depending on risk) required for urgent high-risk requests, with automated enforcement
Suggested waiting periods exist but can be overridden for 'emergencies'
No waiting periods - urgent requests processed immediately regardless of risk level

items.evidence_required: Cooling-off period policy, recent enforcement examples, override logs

items.title: Deadline-Driven Security Bypasses
items.question: How often do employees bypass security procedures due to approaching deadlines or time pressure?

options.label: Never/Rarely - Security procedures maintained regardless of deadlines (less than quarterly)
Occasionally - Monthly deadline-driven bypasses with post-hoc justification
Frequently - Weekly or more deadline-driven bypasses, considered normal operating procedure

items.evidence_required: Bypass incident logs with timestamps and deadline justifications

items.title: Limited-Time Offer Response Protocol
items.question: What procedures exist for verifying 'limited-time opportunities' or 'urgent exclusive offers' presented to employees?

options.label: Formal verification protocol requiring security review before response to any time-limited business opportunity
Informal guidelines suggest verification but no mandatory process
No verification requirements - employees respond to opportunities based on perceived value and urgency

items.evidence_required: Opportunity verification procedure documentation, recent examples
items.soc_mapping: scarcity_indicator detection rate from NLP analysis

items.title: Scarcity Tactics Awareness Training
items.question: What specific training do employees receive on recognizing and resisting artificial scarcity tactics (limited-time pressure, loss framing, deadline manipulation)?

options.label: Regular training includes scarcity psychology, cognitive tunneling recognition, and pressure-resistance techniques with practical scenarios
Generic awareness training mentions urgency tactics but no scarcity-specific or pressure-resistance training
No training on scarcity tactics or psychological pressure recognition

items.evidence_required: Training curriculum covering scarcity psychology, completion records, assessment results

items.title: Emergency Access Tracking and Review
items.question: Are emergency access grants and urgency-justified security exceptions systematically tracked and reviewed?

options.label: All urgency-based exceptions logged with automated review for patterns, monthly analysis of scarcity-driven decisions
Emergency access logged but irregular review, no pattern analysis
No tracking of urgency justifications or emergency access patterns

items.evidence_required: Emergency access logs, review reports, pattern analysis documentation

items.title: Loss-Framed Request Protocols
items.question: How does your organization handle requests framed as preventing losses versus gaining opportunities (e.g., 'Act now or lose access' vs. 'Act now to gain access')?

options.label: Employees trained to recognize loss aversion exploitation, additional verification required for loss-framed urgent requests
No differentiation - all urgent requests treated equally
Loss-framed requests receive priority response without additional scrutiny due to perceived risk of inaction

items.evidence_required: Loss aversion awareness documentation, request handling procedures
items.soc_mapping: loss_framing detection from NLP content analysis

items.title: Competitive/Exclusive Opportunity Verification
items.question: When employees receive 'exclusive opportunities' or 'competitive advantage offers' requiring immediate action or information sharing, what verification occurs?

options.label: Mandatory business verification through established channels before responding to any exclusive or competitive opportunity claims
Employees encouraged to verify but judgment-based, no mandatory process
No verification protocol - opportunities evaluated individually based on perceived competitive value

items.evidence_required: Opportunity verification procedure, recent competitive offer examples

items.title: Temporal Pressure Decision Quality
items.question: How does decision quality (thoroughness, verification, security consideration) change when employees face time pressure or approaching deadlines?

options.label: Decision quality metrics maintained under time pressure through structured protocols and automated safeguards
Some degradation observed but within acceptable ranges, informal pressure management
Significant quality degradation under time pressure - verification skipped, security shortcuts normalized

items.evidence_required: Decision quality analysis comparing normal vs. time-pressure conditions

sections.instructions: Select ONE option for each question. Each answer contributes to the weighted final score. Evidence should be documented for audit trail.

items.text: Tell me about the last time someone in your organization received an urgent request with a tight deadline that required bypassing normal security procedures. What exactly happened?

scoring_guidance.green: Specific example where cooling-off period was enforced despite urgency, verification completed, or request rejected pending proper review
scoring_guidance.yellow: Example shows some verification attempt but expedited process due to deadline pressure
scoring_guidance.red: Example shows immediate compliance with urgent deadline request without verification

followups.text: How long did it take from receiving the urgent request to taking action? What verification steps were performed?
Was the urgency claim later validated as legitimate? How do you track accuracy of urgency claims?

items.text: When employees receive messages like 'Act now or lose access,' 'Limited time offer,' or 'Expires in 24 hours,' how do they typically respond?

scoring_guidance.green: Employees trained to recognize scarcity tactics, mandatory verification before response, examples of resisting artificial urgency
scoring_guidance.yellow: Mixed responses - some employees verify, others respond immediately based on message credibility
scoring_guidance.red: Immediate response to avoid missing opportunity, scarcity creates urgency compliance

followups.text: Can you show me examples of recent limited-time requests your employees received and how they responded?
Do employees receive training on distinguishing legitimate urgency from artificial scarcity tactics?

items.text: How does your organization handle situations where business deadlines (quarter-end, project deadlines, regulatory filings) conflict with security verification timelines?

scoring_guidance.green: Written policies prioritizing security regardless of business deadlines, examples of maintained protocols under pressure
scoring_guidance.yellow: Informal expectation to maintain security but flexibility for 'critical' deadlines
scoring_guidance.red: Business deadlines override security procedures, 'we can't let security slow us down' attitude

followups.text: Describe what happened during your last major business deadline (quarter-end, major project delivery). Were any security procedures modified or bypassed?
What would happen to an employee who insisted on completing security verification even if it meant missing a business deadline?

items.text: When requests are framed as preventing a loss versus gaining something (e.g., 'Reset password now or your account will be locked' vs. 'Reset password to enhance security'), do you notice different employee response patterns?

scoring_guidance.green: Organization recognizes loss aversion exploitation, additional scrutiny for loss-framed urgent requests, employee training on this bias
scoring_guidance.yellow: Awareness that loss-framed requests get more attention but no specific countermeasures
scoring_guidance.red: Loss-framed requests receive priority treatment without additional verification due to fear of negative consequences

followups.text: Can you show me examples of messages employees received that threatened losses (account lockout, access removal, missed opportunity)? How were these handled?
Do employees understand that preventing a $1000 loss feels 2.5x more urgent than gaining $1000, and how attackers exploit this?

items.text: Are there mandatory waiting periods before approving high-risk actions, even when the request claims urgency?

scoring_guidance.green: Formal cooling-off periods enforced with technical controls, specific time requirements based on risk level, documented override process
scoring_guidance.yellow: Suggested waiting periods but can be waived for 'legitimate emergencies'
scoring_guidance.red: No waiting periods - speed valued over security reflection time

followups.text: What is the minimum waiting period for actions like: wire transfers, privileged access grants, sensitive data releases? Can these be overridden?
Show me your logs of emergency override requests - how often are cooling-off periods bypassed and what justifications are used?

items.text: When employees are under resource pressure (budget constraints, time scarcity, competing priorities), how does their security behavior change?

scoring_guidance.green: No observable security degradation under resource pressure, structured protocols maintain quality, pressure explicitly addressed in training
scoring_guidance.yellow: Some security shortcuts observed under pressure but within acceptable range
scoring_guidance.red: Significant security degradation under pressure - verification skipped, shortcuts normalized, 'we're too busy for security' mindset

followups.text: During your busiest periods (tax season, quarter-end, product launches), do you track changes in security incident rates or bypass frequencies?
Describe a situation where someone was dealing with multiple urgent demands. How did they handle a security decision in that context?

items.text: How does your organization track and review security decisions made under urgency or deadline pressure?

scoring_guidance.green: Systematic tracking of urgency-justified decisions, regular pattern analysis, feedback loop to identify artificial scarcity attacks
scoring_guidance.yellow: Basic logging exists but limited review or pattern analysis
scoring_guidance.red: No tracking of urgency context or decision quality under pressure

followups.text: Show me your analysis of the last 90 days of emergency access requests. How many were legitimately urgent versus artificially pressured?
Do you measure decision velocity (time from request to approval) and correlate it with security outcomes?

solutions.title: Mandatory Cooling-Off Period System
solutions.description: Implement technical controls enforcing waiting periods for high-risk decisions regardless of claimed urgency
solutions.implementation: Automated workflow delays: 2 hours for privilege escalation, 24 hours for wire transfers >$10K, 4 hours for sensitive data access. Override requires dual approval with documented business justification and security review.
solutions.technical_controls: Workflow automation with time-delay enforcement, override logging and alerting, escalation requirements

solutions.title: Scarcity Tactics Recognition Training
solutions.description: Comprehensive training program on psychological scarcity exploitation and cognitive tunneling
solutions.implementation: Teach employees to recognize: artificial urgency markers, loss-framing language, limited-availability claims, deadline manipulation. Practice scenarios with scarcity pressure. Explain cognitive science: -13 IQ point effect, 2.5x loss aversion, hyperbolic discounting.
solutions.technical_controls: Training platform with scarcity scenario simulations, knowledge assessments, behavioral competency testing

solutions.title: Urgency Verification Protocol
solutions.description: Structured process for validating urgency claims before expedited processing
solutions.implementation: All urgent requests must answer: (1) What specific harm occurs if action delayed 24 hours? (2) Who can independently verify this urgency? (3) Has urgency been validated through separate channel? Document and track urgency validation accuracy.
solutions.technical_controls: Urgency questionnaire in request workflows, validation tracking database, accuracy reporting

solutions.title: Emergency Access Tracking and Analysis
solutions.description: Comprehensive logging and pattern analysis of urgency-justified security decisions
solutions.implementation: Log all urgency claims with: claimed deadline, business justification, approver, actual outcome. Monthly analysis: urgency claim accuracy, pattern detection for artificial scarcity, feedback loop to identify scarcity-based attacks.
solutions.technical_controls: Centralized urgency logging, NLP analysis for scarcity patterns, dashboard with urgency metrics and trends

solutions.title: Loss-Framing Detection and Countermeasures
solutions.description: Specialized protocols for requests using loss aversion tactics
solutions.implementation: Email gateway and communication analysis flagging loss-framed urgent messages ('or you will lose', 'account will be locked', 'access expires'). Flagged messages receive additional verification requirements. Employee training on 2.5x loss aversion multiplier.
solutions.technical_controls: NLP-based loss-framing detection, automated message flagging, verification requirement enforcement

solutions.title: Deadline-Pressure Decision Quality Safeguards
solutions.description: Maintain security decision quality during high-pressure periods
solutions.implementation: Pre-identify high-pressure periods (quarter-end, tax deadlines, project launches). Deploy additional security support during these periods. Automated reminders of security requirements. Enhanced monitoring for deadline-driven bypasses.
solutions.technical_controls: Calendar-based pressure period tracking, automated security reminders, enhanced monitoring during high-risk periods

solutions.title: Hyperbolic Discounting Mitigation
solutions.description: Counteract tendency to devalue delayed security benefits
solutions.implementation: Reframe security verification as immediate protection rather than future benefit. Make verification process visible and rewarding (gamification, recognition). Reduce friction in verification workflows so delay is minimal.
solutions.technical_controls: Streamlined verification UX, immediate feedback systems, recognition programs for security diligence

solutions.title: Competitive Opportunity Verification System
solutions.description: Structured evaluation process for 'exclusive' or 'limited-time' business opportunities
solutions.implementation: All competitive opportunity claims requiring immediate action/information sharing must undergo: (1) Source verification through known contacts, (2) Business value assessment by stakeholders, (3) Security review for information requests. Track opportunity verification outcomes.
solutions.technical_controls: Opportunity verification workflow, source validation database, outcome tracking

risk_scenarios.title: Limited-Time Phishing with Loss Framing
risk_scenarios.description: Attackers send emails claiming 'Your account will be locked in 24 hours unless you verify credentials' or 'Immediate action required or lose access to critical systems'
risk_scenarios.attack_vector: Email with countdown timers, urgent loss-framed language, credential harvesting links
risk_scenarios.psychological_mechanism: Loss aversion (2.5x weighting) + artificial deadline creates cognitive tunneling, bypassing rational security assessment
risk_scenarios.historical_example: Office 365 credential phishing campaigns with 'Account expires in 24 hours' achieving 34% click-through rates

risk_scenarios.title: Quarter-End Wire Transfer Fraud
risk_scenarios.description: Attackers exploit end-of-quarter pressure to request urgent wire transfers for 'critical deals' that will be 'lost' if not completed immediately
risk_scenarios.attack_vector: Executive impersonation during high-pressure business periods requesting urgent financial transactions
risk_scenarios.psychological_mechanism: Scarcity-induced cognitive load (-13 IQ points) + business deadline pressure + loss aversion creates perfect storm
risk_scenarios.historical_example: Repeated BEC incidents targeting finance departments during quarter-end when verification resistance is lowest

risk_scenarios.title: Fake Investment/Partnership Opportunity
risk_scenarios.description: Attackers present 'exclusive limited-time investment opportunities' or 'competitive advantage partnerships' requiring immediate information sharing or financial commitment
risk_scenarios.attack_vector: Business opportunity scams using artificial scarcity and competitive pressure
risk_scenarios.psychological_mechanism: FOMO + competitive scarcity + hyperbolic discounting (immediate opportunity vs. delayed due diligence)
risk_scenarios.historical_example: Cryptocurrency investment scams using 'exclusive pre-sale' artificial scarcity to extract millions

risk_scenarios.title: Regulatory Deadline Exploitation
risk_scenarios.description: Attackers impersonate regulatory bodies claiming urgent compliance deadlines requiring immediate data submission or system access
risk_scenarios.attack_vector: Fake compliance notices exploiting regulatory deadlines (tax filing, audit responses, reporting requirements)
risk_scenarios.psychological_mechanism: Regulatory fear + deadline pressure + scarcity-induced tunneling on compliance task
risk_scenarios.historical_example: IRS phishing scams during tax season exploiting filing deadline anxiety

risk_scenarios.title: Vendor Contract/Service Expiration Scam
risk_scenarios.description: Attackers claim to be vendors warning of imminent service expiration unless immediate payment or credential update occurs
risk_scenarios.attack_vector: Fake vendor communications about expiring services, contracts, or subscriptions
risk_scenarios.psychological_mechanism: Loss aversion (service disruption fear) + operational scarcity concern + urgency pressure
risk_scenarios.historical_example: Domain registration scams claiming 'domain expires in 48 hours' targeting business owners
